Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Aerococcus viridans (MIC=0.3-0.6 µM), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=1.25-2.5 µM), Bacillus megaterium (MIC=2.5-5 µM), Enterococcus fecalis (MIC>20 µM), Saphylococcus aureus (MIC>40 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli 363 (MI=10-20 µM), Vibrio vulnificus (MIC>20 µM), Salmonella thyphimurium (MIC>40 µM), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC>40 µM).Fungi:Fusarium oxysporum (MIC=5-10 µM), Botrytis cinerea (MIC=5-10 µM), Neurospora crassa (MIC=1.25-2.5 µM), Aspergillus fumigatus (MIC>20 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Posesses antibacterial and antifungal activity. Presents chitin-binding activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Higher expression in hemocytes and to a lesser extent in heart, testis, gills, intestine, lymphonoid organ and hepatopancreas. Traces in eyes and subcuticular epithelium. Not present in the brain.
Sequence Information.Developmental stage: Expression decreases 3 hours after microbial challenge to return to control levels after 12 hours and slightly increases after 24 hours.
Sequence Information.PTM: C-terminal amidation and contains three disulfide bonds 32-47; 36-54; 48-55.

Literature.Title: Penaeidins, a new family of antimicrobial peptides isolated from the shrimp Penaeus vannamei (Decapoda).
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Bulet P, Loew D, Van Dorsselaer A, Rodriguez J, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Recombinant expression and range of activity of penaeidins, antimicrobial peptides from penaeid shrimp.
Literature.Author: Destoumieux D, Bulet P, Strub JM, Van Dorsselaer A, Bachère E.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of the recombinant penaeidin-3, a shrimp antimicrobial peptide.
Literature.Author: Yang Y, Poncet J, Garnier J, Zatylny C, Bachère E, Aumelas A.
